page.title: 15PIGEON RACING IN HAUGHTON
page.content: Pigeons are raced in the summer months and shown in the winter. There are 6 pigeon fanciers in our area who enjoy their sport very much. They are all members of Bunbury Homing Society which in turn is a member of the Cheshire Plains Federation. The racing season is divided into three sections which are; the Inland Old Bird races, the Water races - again with the old birds - and inland young bird races. The birds race from the south - the nearest race point being Hereford, and the furthest being Niost - a distance of 476 miles. The federation owns a transporter which collects the pigeons from the clubs and transports them to the race point. The fanciers are then informed of the time of liberation and the prevailing wind. A good pigeon on an easy flight can travel at a speed of a mile a minute.
